thing-type.label: MSP-3-1-X1 Z-Wave Plus Micro Smart Plug ON/OFF
thing-type.description: Z-Wave Plus Micro Smart Plug ON/OFF

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Default State
parameter.description:
Overview

This parameter defines the status of the Micro Smart Plug after a power outage or after being plugged

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Follow State
parameter.description:
Overview

This parameter allows to enable or disable Group 2 & Group 3

The value may be the sum of available values. For example, if you want to enable Group 2 & 3, the parameter value is 1+2=3

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Always On
parameter.description:
Overview

This parameter forces the Micro Smart Plug status to be ON. While enable it is not possible to switch OFF the plug (local or wireless).

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Power Auto-Sending Report
parameter.description:
Overview

This parameter will send a power report automatically if  the power value  changes of x % W (Watt) compared to the last report.

options.option: Power Auto-Polling Report Enable if 1% (to100%) variation

parameter.name: config_22_2
parameter.label: 22: Overload Report
parameter.description:
Overview

This parameter will switch off the Micro Smart Plug in case the power is above  x W (Watt) and send an alarm to the primary controller. This parameter has the highest execution priority between all the metering configurations for security reason.

options.option: Overload Report enable with a upper limit of 1 W (to 2000W)

parameter.name: config_23_2
parameter.label: 23: Energy Auto-Sending Report
parameter.description:
Overview

This parameter will send a new energy report automatically if the energy value  changes of x Wh (Watt-hour) compared to the last report.

options.option: Energy Auto-Polling Report enable if 1 Wh variation

parameter.name: config_24_2
parameter.label: 24: Metering Heartbeat
parameter.description:
Overview

Whatever other metering reports, this parameter will send one power and  one energy report to the lifeline every x s (Seconds).

options.option: Metering Pulse enable and send report every 1 s

parameter.name: config_25_2
parameter.label: 25: Power High Threshold
parameter.description:
Overview

This parameter defines the High Threshold power value.

options.option: Power High Threshold enable with the value from 1 W

parameter.name: config_26_2
parameter.label: 26: Power Low Threshold
parameter.description:
Overview

This parameter defines the Low Threshold power value.

options.option: Power Low Threshold enable with the value from 1 W

parameter.name: config_27_1
parameter.label: 27: Power Threshold Action
parameter.description:
Overview

This parameter will define the Micro Smart Plug actions if the power Low and  High Threshold are reached.

The value may be the sum of available values. For example, if you want:

  • Power High Threshold Action is enable and sent ON to Group 4 (3)
  • Power Low Threshold Action is enable and sent OFF to Group 5 (4)

the parameter value must be 3+4=7.

options.option: Power High Threshold -> command OFF to Group 4
Power High Threshold -> command ON to Group 4
Power High Threshold -> command OFF to Group 5
Power High Threshold -> command ON to Group 5

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifetime
parameter.description:
Overview

This group is generally used to report information of the Micro  Smart Plug to the Main Controller of the network.

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Follow State
parameter.description:
Overview

When the Micro Smart Plug is switched ON (respectively OFF)
using the local button, it will send ON (respectively OFF) command
to the associated devices. No command is sent if the Micro Smart
Plug is switched ON or OFF wirelessly.
This group is configurable through the parameter 3.

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Follow Complementary State
parameter.description:
Overview

When the Micro Smart Plug is switched ON (respectively OFF)
using the local button, it will send OFF (respectively ON) command
to the associated devices. No command is sent if the Micro Smart
Plug is switched ON or OFF wirelessly.
This group is configurable through the parameter 3.

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: Metering - High Threshold - Set On/Off
parameter.description:
Overview

When the Micro Smart Plug reaches over the high threshold of
power defined by the configuration parameter, it will send OFF or
ON command to the associated devices.
This group is configurable through the parameter 25 and 27.

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: Metering - Low Threshold - Set On/Off
parameter.description:
Overview

When the Micro Smart Plug reaches below the low threshold of
power defined by the configuration parameter, it will send OFF or
ON command to the associated devices.
This group is configurable through the parameters 26 and 27.

parameter.name: group_6
parameter.label: 6: Metering - Report
parameter.description:
Overview

All the meter reports and notifications triggered by Metering
parameters will be reported to the devices present in this group.
This group is configurable through the parameters 21, 22, 23 and
24.
